title: Bride-to-be who fleeced fiancé out of £11k stag do cash living with new man
text:

A bride-to-be who fleeced her fiance and his 30 friends out of £11,000 stag do cash is now living with a new man.

Rachel Doran, 32, swindled her ex Chris Mahone and his friends out of the cash - leaving them stranded at Leeds Bradford airport as they prepared to fly to Ibiza.

Now, while Chris struggles to start again because the deceit has shattered his trust in women, Rachel is now in a relationship with a former soldier.

She now lives in Egremont, Cumbria, with Ian Flinn, 32, who answered the door of their terraced home in his dressing gown today.

Mr Flinn said neither he nor Rachel wished to comment, saying: 'We're alright thanks pal.'

A neighbour described them as 'a nice couple' who had lived together in the house for between 12 and 18 months.

(Image: MDM)

Last month Rachel accompanied Mr Flinn to his brother's 40th birthday party, which he described on social media as a 'brilliant family night.'

Doran is pictured smiling next to Mr Flinn and his brother.

She was given a 15 month suspended sentence and ordered to pay back £3,600 to Mr Mahone and the 30 stags who had planned to fly to Ibiza.

The party were left stranded at Leeds Bradford airport because Doran had squandered their cash on herself and sent them to the airport with forged flight documents, which were immediately spotted by Jet2 staff.

One member of the stag party Glyn Edwards, 33, told Mail Online the sentence shows crime does pay.

Mr Edwards said: 'It sounds like being a criminal pays off. If you are looking at the fine she got it was a quarter of what she got away with. No justice was done.

(Image: Facebook)

'I imagine she will be paying back a pound a week, we were never asking for that money back anyway.

'She's got away with some of that money as well whether she's got it or spent it I wouldn't know.'

He said he had seen Mr Mahone for a drink a fortnight ago and he was 'doing OK.'

At the home in Cleator Moor, Cumbria, he once shared with Doran, Mr Mahone's mother said that he did not wish to comment.

In a victim personal statement he described how his trust in women has been shattered.

The nuclear process worker at Sellafield said: ' 'I felt so let down. I trusted her and was getting ready to settle down and spend the rest of my life with her.

'I loved her at the time and I have not been able to move on because I cannot trust anyone else in the way I trusted Rachel.

'I am trying to move on but I find it difficult to talk to women because I am scared of getting hurt.

(Image: PA)

'My friends are gutted, they don't want the money back, they just want justice done. My friends could have turned on me but they didn't.

'I don't want to see Rachel again I just want some closure. Maybe when she has been sentenced I will regain some of my confidence and kickstart my life again.

'I want Rachel to learn from what she has done.'

Doran's barrister Kim Whittlestone told the court that she had begun a new relationship.

She said: 'She has started building bridges. She has commenced a new relationship and is now in employment at a local factory who are aware of theoffending behaviour earning £19 a week.

'She lives with her new partner in privately rented accommodation'

Ms Whittlestone said that her family had 'effectively washed their hands of her' after her deceit came to light. Doran had ended up in a hostel, she said, where she'd made an attempt to commit suicide.

(Image: MDM)

The continuing rift was confirmed by her father Joseph today.

He told Mailonline: 'I've jacked her off, I don't see her, I don't know who she's with or anything else.'

Judge Nicholas Barker told Doran: 'You still have difficulty understanding where the truth lies.'

He sentenced her to the suspended sentence and ordered she compensation of £3,600 at a rate of £150 a month which he said should be split equally between the stag party.

He also ordered that she do 20 rehabilitation activity days and 240 hours unpaid work to fill up her time when she was not at work.
description: Rachel Doran, 32, swindled her ex Chris Mahone and his friends out of the cash - leaving them stranded at Leeds Bradford airport as they prepared to fly to Ibiza
